info.headline: Tropical Storm Warning issued November 13 at 3:07AM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
info.description:
...TROPICAL STORM MAN-YI MOVING WEST...
.NEW INFORMATION... As of midnight, Guam is in Condition of Readiness 1. Shelters have been opened at Maria Ulloa Elementary School, George Washington High School, and Talafofo Elementary School.
.AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides recommended actions for people in Guam and the Northern Marianas.
.Watches/Warnings... A Tropical storm warning continues for Guam, Rota, Tinian, and Saipan.
A Flood Watch is in effect for Guam and Rota. Please listen closely for any Flood Warnings that might be in effect for your area.
Please check the latest public and marine forecasts for detailed information about additional hazards.
.STORM INFORMATION... At 2 AM ChST...the center of Tropical Storm Man-yi (25W) was located near latitude 13.4N...longitude 145.7E. This was about 60 miles east of Guam. Storm motion was west, 270 degrees, at 19 mph. Storm intensity was 50 mph.
.SITUATION OVERVIEW... Tropical Storm Man-yi continues to approach Guam and will pass very close to Guam within the next 6 hours. Tropical Storm force winds, heavy rain and frequent lightning will accompany the center as it passes. Weather will begin to improve around mid-morning and will be nearly normalized by sunset.
.PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...
info.instruction: Seek safe shelter NOW if you have not already done so. Damaging winds are imminent as Tropical Storm Man-yi approaches. Gusty winds and heavy rains can cause outside activities to become dangerous. If you live in a metal roof or container home, leave it for more substantial shelter.

parameter.value: Tropical Storm Warning remains in effect
